channel.title: Uhm i'm a little freaked out right now XD
channel.description:
okay so a friend of mine decided to add the moparscape client to his website on freewebs (which i advised him to do otherwise -.-) and when i went to see the link he sent me, the client loaded, and then meatspin pops up. I got nothing against gays, but i sure as hell don't want to see them mating while trying to use a webclient.
Any particular reason the anti-leech for this client is this site?

item.title: Uhm i'm a little freaked out right now XD
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Tom_BETA:

I’m sure something like this used to happen with the status page. I thought I’d try and be smart one day and put something like runescape.com.

Not that I remember, certainly not on the current page. I suppose it could have happened on the old one.

Read full topic

Yea, you don’t really want to just embed MoparScape 3.2 in your site.

I’ve matured (or just lost my sense of humor) since then though, MoparScape 4 just redirects you back to moparisthebest.com…

item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:7, topic:392479”][quote author=Ix Soulcist xI link=topic=489648.msg3580852#msg3580852 date=1303780150]
If I remember correctly this was added because Moparisthebest didn’t want others to crack it or something which if done, the client will lead the person to some porn website, something along those lines.
[/quote]

If I remember correctly he added it so people wouldn’t fuck his bandwidth up? :S[/quote]
I don’t remember to be honest, he posted it abut it in some thread before not long ago. It had something to do with an anti-leech or something.
